articleinfo.title: Debathena Help

abstract.para: Debathena brings Athena functionality to Debian-based GNU/Linux distributions.

articleinfo.releaseinfo: This document includes basic information about Debathena.

legalnotice.title: Feedback
legalnotice.para: To report a bug or make a suggestion regarding this document, please contact us at debathena@mit.edu.

sect1.title: What is Debathena?
sect1.para: Debathena brings Athena functionality to Debian-based Linux distributions, including Ubuntu. In the public Athena clusters throughout campus, IS&T has deployed Ubuntu workstations running Debathena.
Debathena's primary documentation is available at http://debathena.mit.edu.

sect1.title: How do I start a web browser?
sect1.para: The Firefox web browser is the default web browser on Debathena. You can launch it by clicking the Firefox icon in the panel, or from the Applications menu: ApplicationsInternetFirefox Web Browser.

sect1.title: How do I check my e-mail?
sect1.para: You can click the mail icon in the panel, or from the Applications menu: ApplicationsInternetAthena Mail.

sect1.title: How do I log out?
sect1.para: You can click the power button icon at the top-right of the screen, and choose Log Out... from the menu.

sect1.title: How do I start a Terminal window?
sect1.para: You can start a Terminal window from the panel at the top of the screen by choosing ApplicationsAccessoriesTerminal.

sect1.title: Where is the Ubuntu Documentation?
sect1.para: The Ubuntu Documentation is available here or by clicking the "Help Topics" button in the toolbar of this help browser window.
